<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><div style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 25%"><div style="border-top: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 1pt">&#160;</div></div><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Indicate
by check mark whether the registrant is a well-known seasoned issuer, as defined in Rule&#160;405 of the Securities Act. &#8239;&#8239;<span id="xdx_901_edei--EntityWellKnownSeasonedIssuer_c20240101__20241231_z7AokIWfEJP2"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" id="Fact000029" name="dei:EntityWellKnownSeasonedIssuer">Yes</ix:nonNumeric></span>&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">x</span></span>&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;No&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Indicate
by check mark if the registrant is not required to file reports pursuant to Section&#160;13 or 15(d)&#160;of the Act. &#8239;&#8239;Yes&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></span>&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;<span id="xdx_909_edei--EntityVoluntaryFilers_c20240101__20241231_zcdBtqBXRFJd"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" id="Fact000030" name="dei:EntityVoluntaryFilers">No</ix:nonNumeric></span>&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">x</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Indicate
by check mark whether the registrant (1)&#160;has filed all reports required to be filed by Section&#160;13 or 15(d)&#160;of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934 (&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;) during the preceding 12&#160;months (or for such shorter period that the registrant
was required to file such reports), and (2)&#160;has been subject to such filing requirements for the past 90&#160;days. &#8239;&#8239;<span id="xdx_903_edei--EntityCurrentReportingStatus_c20240101__20241231_ziJ84uJzs1nc"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" id="Fact000031" name="dei:EntityCurrentReportingStatus">Yes</ix:nonNumeric></span>&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">x</span></span>&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;No&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Indicate
by check mark whether the registrant has submitted electronically every Interactive Data File required to be submitted pursuant to Rule&#160;405
of Regulation S-T (&#167; 232.405 of this chapter) during the preceding 12&#160;months (or for such shorter period that the registrant
was required to submit such files). &#8239;&#8239;<span id="xdx_90E_edei--EntityInteractiveDataCurrent_c20240101__20241231_zz0YIycI4Su2"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" id="Fact000032" name="dei:EntityInteractiveDataCurrent">Yes</ix:nonNumeric></span>&#8239;&#8239;</span><span style="font-family: Wingdings">x</span>&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;No&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant
is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, a non-accelerated filer, a smaller reporting company or an emerging growth company.
See the definitions of &#8220;large accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;accelerated filer,&#8221; &#8220;smaller reporting company&#8221;
and &#8220;emerging growth company&#8221; in Rule&#160;12b-2 of the Exchange Act:</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse">
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td style="width: 27%; padding-left: 0.1in; text-indent: -0.1in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><span id="xdx_900_edei--EntityFilerCategory_c20240101__20241231_zYf6fTBVuWp"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" format="ixt-sec:entityfilercategoryen" id="Fact000033" name="dei:EntityFilerCategory">Large accelerated filer</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap; width: 3%">&#160;</td>

    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Smaller reporting company</span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><span style="font-family: Wingdings"><span id="xdx_907_edei--EntitySmallBusiness_c20240101__20241231_zx5r1anaSsyg"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" format="ixt:booleanfalse" id="Fact000034" name="dei:EntitySmallBusiness">&#168;</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td></tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td>&#160;</td>

    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><span style="font-family: Wingdings"><span id="xdx_906_edei--EntityEmergingGrowthCompany_c20240101__20241231_z2o2QikWyBo"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" format="ixt:booleanfalse" id="Fact000035" name="dei:EntityEmergingGrowthCompany">&#168;</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></span></td>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">If an emerging growth company, indicate by check
mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting
standards provided pursuant to Section&#160;13(a)&#160;of the Exchange Act. &#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">Indicate by check mark whether the Registrant
has filed a report on and attestation to its management&#8217;s assessment of the effectiveness of its internal control over financial
reporting under Section&#160;404(b)&#160;of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (15 U.S.C. 7262(b)) by the registered public accounting firm that
prepared or issued its audit report. <span style="font-family: Wingdings"><span id="xdx_900_edei--IcfrAuditorAttestationFlag_c20240101__20241231_zovqOW7wMn9e"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" format="ixt:booleantrue" id="Fact000036" name="dei:IcfrAuditorAttestationFlag">x</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">If securities are registered pursuant to Section
12(b) of the Act, indicate by check mark whether the financial statements of the registrant included in the filing reflect the correction
of an error to previously issued financial statements. <span style="font-family: Wingdings"><span id="xdx_90B_edei--DocumentFinStmtErrorCorrectionFlag_c20240101__20241231_zRySIyeF4gE"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="From2024-01-01to2024-12-31" format="ixt:booleanfalse" id="Fact000037" name="dei:DocumentFinStmtErrorCorrectionFlag">&#168;</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">Indicate by check mark whether any of those error
corrections are restatements that required a recovery analysis of incentive-based compensation received by any of the registrant&#8217;s
executive officers during the relevant recovery period pursuant to &#167;240.10D-1(b). <span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Indicate
by check mark whether the registrant is a shell company (as defined in Rule&#160;12b-2 of the Exchange Act). &#8239;&#8239;Yes&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Wingdings">&#168;</span></span>&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;No&#8239;&#8239;<span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><span style="font-family: Wingdings"><span id="xdx_90E_edei--EntityShellCompany_dxL_c20240101__20241231_zpTBT5AQzKzg" title="::XDX::false"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden: xdx2ixbrl0038">x</span></span></span></span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">The aggregate market value of voting stock
held by non-affiliates of the registrant, as of June&#160;28, 2024, the last business day of the registrant&#8217;s most recently
completed second fiscal quarter, was $<span id="xdx_908_edei--EntityPublicFloat_iI_dxL_c20240628_zoo2qZVSxJoj" title="::XDX::550170000000"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden: xdx2ixbrl0039">550.17</span></span>&#160;billion
(based on the closing price for shares of the registrant&#8217;s Common Stock as reported by the Nasdaq Global Select Market on
June&#160;28, 2024). Shares of Common Stock held by each executive officer and director have been excluded in that such persons may
be deemed to be affiliates. This determination of affiliate status is not necessarily a conclusive determination for other
purposes.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.25in">As of January&#160;22, 2025, there were <span id="xdx_903_edei--EntityCommonStockSharesOutstanding_iI_c20250122_zqMgwAsbXazd"><ix:nonFraction name="dei:EntityCommonStockSharesOutstanding" contextRef="AsOf2025-01-22" id="Fact000040" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="INF" unitRef="Shares">3,216,517,037</ix:nonFraction></span>
shares of the registrant&#8217;s Common Stock outstanding.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><span id="a_001"></span><b>EXPLANATORY NOTE</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">On January&#160;30, 2025, Tesla,&#160;Inc. (&#8220;Tesla,&#8221;
the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; or &#8220;our&#8221;) filed our Annual Report on Form&#160;10-K for the
fiscal&#160;year ended December&#160;31, 2024 (the &#8220;Original Form&#160;10-K&#8221;). The Original Form&#160;10-K omitted Part&#160;III,&#160;Items
10 (<i>Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance</i>), 11 (<i>Executive Compensation</i>), 12 (<i>Security Ownership of Certain
Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters</i>), 13 (<i>Certain Relationships and Related Transactions, and Director
Independence</i>) and 14 (<i>Principal Accountant Fees and Services</i>) in reliance on General Instruction G(3)&#160;to Form&#160;10-K,
which provides that such information may be either incorporated by reference from the registrant&#8217;s definitive proxy statement or
included in an amendment to Form&#160;10-K, in either case filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) not
later than 120&#160;days after the end of the fiscal&#160;year.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">T<span style="font-size: 10pt">he
Board of Directors has not yet established the date of the 2025 annual meeting of shareholders. When the date is established, the Company
will announce it in its filings made with the SEC. Consequently, we currently expect that our definitive proxy statement for the 2025
annual meeting of shareholders will be filed later than the 120<sup>th</sup> day after the end of the last fiscal&#160;year. Accordingly,
this Amendment No.&#160;1 to Form&#160;10-K (this &#8220;Amendment&#8221;) is being filed solely to:</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>amend Part&#160;III,&#160;Items 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14 of the Original Form&#160;10-K to include the information required by such Items;</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>delete the reference on the cover of the Original Form&#160;10-K to the incorporation by reference of portions of our proxy statement
into Part&#160;III of the Original Form&#160;10-K; and</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>file new certifications of our principal executive officer and principal financial officer as exhibits to this Amendment under Item&#160;15
of Part&#160;IV hereof, pursuant to Rule&#160;12b-15 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;).</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">This Amendment does not otherwise change or update
any of the disclosures set forth in the Original Form&#160;10-K and does not otherwise reflect any events occurring after the filing of
the Original Form&#160;10-K.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"><b>TESLA,&#160;INC.</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"><b>AMENDMENT NO.&#160;1 TO ANNUAL REPORT ON FORM&#160;10-K/A</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"><b>FOR THE&#160;YEAR ENDED DECEMBER&#160;31, 2024</b></p>

    <td style="white-space: nowrap; text-align: right"><a href="#a_001">1</a></td></tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td>&#160;</td>

  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td style="padding-left: 0.1in; text-indent: -0.1in"><a href="#a_003"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Item 10.</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><a href="#a_003"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap; text-align: right"><a href="#a_003">1</a></td></tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td style="padding-left: 0.1in; text-indent: -0.1in"><a href="#a_004"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Item 11.</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><a href="#a_004"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Executive Compensation</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap; text-align: right"><a href="#a_004">5</a></td></tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">
    <td style="padding-left: 0.1in; text-indent: -0.1in"><a href="#a_005"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Item 12.</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><a href="#a_005"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters</span></a></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: center"><span id="a_002"></span><b>PART&#160;III</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><span id="a_003"></span><b>ITEM&#160;10.&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;DIRECTORS, EXECUTIVE
OFFICERS AND CORPORATE GOVERNANCE</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><b><i>Background and Qualifications</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The names of the members of Tesla&#8217;s Board
of Directors (the &#8220;Board&#8221;), their respective ages, their positions with Tesla and other biographical information as of April&#160;30,
2025 are set forth below. Except for Messrs.&#160;Elon Musk and Kimbal Musk, who are brothers, there are no other family relationships
among any of our directors or executive officers.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Elon
Musk </i></b></span>is the Technoking of Tesla and has served as our Chief Executive Officer since October&#160;2008 and as a member
of the Board since April&#160;2004. Mr.&#160;Musk has also served as Chief Executive Officer, Chief Technology Officer and Chairman
of Space Exploration Technologies Corporation, a company which develops and launches advanced rockets and spacecraft
(&#8220;SpaceX&#8221;), since May&#160;2002, served as Chairman of the Board of SolarCity Corporation, a solar installation company
(&#8220;SolarCity&#8221;), from July&#160;2006 until its acquisition by us in November&#160;2016, served as Chief Technology Officer
of X Corp., a social media company (&#8220;X&#8221;), since October&#160;2022 and served as the Chief Executive Officer and Treasurer
of X.AI Corp., an artificial intelligence company (&#8220;xAI&#8221;), since March&#160;2023. Following the March&#160;2025 merger of
X and xAI, he now serves as the Chief Executive Officer of X.AI Holdings Corp. Mr.&#160;Musk is also a founder of The Boring Company
(&#8220;TBC&#8221;), an infrastructure company, and Neuralink Corporation, a company focused on developing brain-machine interfaces.
Mr.&#160;Musk is also involved with the Department of Government Efficiency. Prior to SpaceX, Mr.&#160;Musk co-founded PayPal, an
electronic payment system, which was acquired by eBay in October&#160;2002, and Zip2 Corporation, a provider of Internet enterprise
software and services, which was acquired by Compaq in March&#160;1999. Mr.&#160;Musk also served on the board of directors of
Endeavor Group Holdings,&#160;Inc. from April&#160;2021 to June&#160;2022. Mr.&#160;Musk holds a B.A. in Physics from the University
of Pennsylvania and a B.S. in Business from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">As our Chief Executive Officer, one of our founders
and our largest shareholder, Mr.&#160;Musk brings historical knowledge, operational and technical expertise and continuity to the Board.
Mr.&#160;Musk guided Tesla from an early-stage startup, through its IPO in 2010, to transformative growth into one of the most valuable
companies in the world. Mr.&#160;Musk&#8217;s leadership and unique vision has played a key role in our mission to accelerate the world&#8217;s
transition to sustainable energy.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Robyn
Denholm</i></b></span> has been a member of the Board since August&#160;2014 and its Chair since November&#160;2018. In
January&#160;2021, Ms.&#160;Denholm joined Blackbird Ventures, a venture capital firm, as an Operating Partner, where she works with
the founders of later-stage technology companies. In 2024, she transitioned to a role on the Board of Directors. Ms. Denholm
actively champions the Australian technology sector and was the Inaugural Chair of the Technology Council of Australia, and
currently serves as a Board Director. She also founded Wollemi Capital Group in 2021, with a mission to invest in ventures that
deliver a positive impact. The firm&#8217;s investment portfolio spans environmental, venture capital and community focused
investments, and includes majority ownership in two professional basketball teams, the Sydney Kings and Sydney Flames, and most
recently, the majority ownership of the Women&#8217;s National Basketball league in Australia. From January&#160;2017 through
June&#160;2019, Ms.&#160;Denholm was with Telstra Corporation Limited, a telecommunications company (&#8220;Telstra&#8221;), where
she served as Chief Financial Officer and Head of Strategy from October&#160;2018 through June&#160;2019, and Chief Operations
Officer from January&#160;2017 to October&#160;2018. Prior to Telstra, from August&#160;2007 to July&#160;2016, Ms.&#160;Denholm was
with Juniper Networks,&#160;Inc., a manufacturer of networking equipment, serving in executive roles including Executive Vice
President, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operations Officer. Prior to joining Juniper Networks, Ms.&#160;Denholm served in
various executive roles at Sun Microsystems,&#160;Inc. from January&#160;1996 to August&#160;2007. Ms.&#160;Denholm also served at
Toyota Motor Corporation Australia for seven&#160;years and at Arthur Andersen&#160;&amp; Company for five&#160;years in various
finance assignments. Ms.&#160;Denholm previously served as a director of ABB&#160;Ltd. Ms.&#160;Denholm is a Fellow of the Institute
of Chartered Accountants of Australia/New Zealand, a member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, and holds a
Bachelor&#8217;s degree in Economics from the University of Sydney, and a Master&#8217;s degree in Commerce and a Doctor of Business
Administration (honoris causa) from the University of New South Wales.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 4; Options: NewSection; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->1<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Ms.&#160;Denholm brings nearly 30&#160;years of
executive leadership experience at both NYSE and Nasdaq listed companies, including significant risk management, financial and accounting
expertise, as well as technology leadership experience. Ms.&#160;Denholm has extensive knowledge of both the automotive and technology
industries, including serving as the Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operations Officer of two technology companies.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Ira
Ehrenpreis</i></b></span> has been a member of the Board since May&#160;2007. Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis has been a venture capitalist since
1996. He is a founder and managing member of DBL Partners, a leading impact investing venture capital firm formed in 2015. Previously,
he led the Energy Innovation practice at Technology Partners. Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis has served on the board and Executive Committee, including
as Annual Meeting Chairman, of the National Venture Capital Association (NVCA). Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis currently serves as the Chairman of
the VCNetwork, the largest and most active California venture capital organization, and as the President of the Western Association of
Venture Capitalists (WAVC), the oldest venture capital organization in California. Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis is also deeply involved in the
energy technology sector. He currently serves on the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) Advisory Council, the University of Texas
at Austin Energy Institute Advisory Board, and the Stanford Precourt Institute for Energy Advisory Council, and has served on the advisory
boards of many industry groups, including the American Council on Renewable Energy, the Cleantech Venture Network (Past Chairman of Advisory
Board) and the Stanford Global Climate and Energy Project (GCEP). He was also Chairman of the Clean-Tech Investor Summit for nine&#160;years.
Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis served for&#160;years as the Chairman of the Silicon Valley Innovation&#160;&amp; Entrepreneurship Forum (SVIEF) and
on the Advisory Board of the Forum for Women Entrepreneurs (FWE). Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis is an inductee of the International Green Industry
Hall of Fame. In 2018, the National Venture Capital Association awarded Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis with the industry&#8217;s &#8220;Outstanding
Service Award&#8221; for career contributions to the venture capital industry. In 2023, the Japan Society of Northern California honored
Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis with its 2023 Visionary Award for his &#8220;Pioneering Leadership in Impact Investing and the Global Sustainability
Community.&#8221; Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis was awarded the 2018 NACD Directorship 100 for his influential leadership in the boardroom and corporate
governance community. Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis holds a B.A. from the University of California, Los Angeles and a J.D. and M.B.A. from Stanford
University.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis is an acknowledged leader in
the energy, technology, impact and venture capital industries, where he serves on several industry boards, and brings valuable insights
in corporate governance, strategic growth and shareholder values. Mr.&#160;Ehrenpreis&#8217; long tenure on Tesla&#8217;s Board also provides
the Company with stability and experience as it navigates through different challenges.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Joe
Gebbia </i></b></span>has been a member of the Board since September&#160;2022. Mr.&#160;Gebbia co-founded Airbnb,&#160;Inc. in 2008 and
has served on Airbnb&#8217;s board of directors since 2009. In 2022, Mr.&#160;Gebbia launched Samara, which produces fully customized,
factory-made homes designed to create rental income, house family, support work from home, or bundled together, to form new types of housing
communities. Mr.&#160;Gebbia received dual degrees in Graphic Design and Industrial Design from the Rhode Island School of Design, where
he currently serves on the institution&#8217;s Board of Trustees. Mr.&#160;Gebbia is the Chairman of Airbnb.org, and also serves on the
Olympic Refuge Foundation and leadership councils for UNHCR, Tent.org and Malala Fund. Mr.&#160;Gebbia is a sought-after speaker on design
and entrepreneurship, and has been named in BusinessWeek&#8217;s Top 20 Best Young Tech Entrepreneurs,&#160;Inc. Magazine&#8217;s Thirty-under-Thirty,
Fortune&#8217;s Forty-under-Forty, and one of Fast Company&#8217;s Most Creative People.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Mr.&#160;Gebbia has valuable experience derived
from founding and leading a global public company. The Board benefits from his entrepreneurial background, as well as his experience in
design, innovation, brand development and management of complex regulatory environments.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>James
Murdoch</i></b></span> has been a member of the Board since July&#160;2017. Mr.&#160;Murdoch has been the Chief Executive Officer of Lupa
Systems, a private holding company that he founded, since March&#160;2019. Previously, Mr.&#160;Murdoch held a number of leadership roles
at Twenty-First Century Fox,&#160;Inc., a media company (&#8220;21CF&#8221;), over two decades, including its Chief Executive Officer
from 2015 to March&#160;2019, its Co-Chief Operating Officer from 2014 to 2015, its Deputy Chief Operating Officer and Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer,&#160;International from 2011 to 2014 and its Chairman and Chief Executive, Europe and Asia from 2007 to 2011. Previously,
he served as the Chief Executive Officer of Sky plc from 2003 to 2007, and as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of STAR Group Limited,
a subsidiary of 21CF, from 2000 to 2003. Mr.&#160;Murdoch formerly served on the board of News Corporation from 2013 to 2020. In addition,
he has served on the boards of 21CF, Sky plc, GlaxoSmithKline plc and Sotheby&#8217;s.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 5; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->2<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Mr.&#160;Murdoch brings to the Board his decades
of executive and board experience across numerous companies. Tesla&#8217;s Board benefits from his extensive knowledge of international
markets and strategies and experience with the adoption of new technologies.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Kimbal
Musk</i></b></span> has been a member of the Board since April&#160;2004. Mr.&#160;Musk is co-founder and Executive Chairman of The Kitchen
Restaurant Group, a growing family of businesses with the goal of providing all Americans with access to real food that was founded in
2004. In 2010, Mr.&#160;Musk became the Executive Director of Big Green (formerly The Kitchen Community), a non-profit organization that
creates learning gardens in schools across the United States. Mr.&#160;Musk also co-founded Square Roots, an urban farming company growing
fresh, local greens in climate-controlled, AI equipped shipping containers, in 2016, and serves as its Chairman. In 2022, Mr.&#160;Musk
founded Nova Sky Stories, with a mission to empower producers and artists to bring art to the skies with drone light shows, and serves
as its Chief Executive Officer. Previously, Mr.&#160;Musk was a co-founder of Zip2 Corporation, a provider of Internet enterprise software
and services, which was acquired by Compaq in March&#160;1999. In 2006, Mr.&#160;Musk became CEO of OneRiot, a realtime search engine
that was acquired by Walmart in 2011. In addition, Mr.&#160;Musk has served on the boards of SpaceX and Chipotle Mexican Grill,&#160;Inc.
Mr.&#160;Musk holds a B. Comm. in business from Queen&#8217;s University and is a graduate of The French Culinary Institute in New York
City.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Mr.&#160;Musk has extensive senior leadership business
experience in the technology, retail and consumer markets, and a robust understanding of mission-driven ventures. Mr.&#160;Musk also provides
valuable expertise based on his experience on the Tesla Board and is able to apply his unique understanding of the business to the strategy
and execution of the Company.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>JB
Straubel </i></b></span>has been a member of the Board since May&#160;2023. Mr.&#160;Straubel is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer
of Redwood Materials&#160;Inc., a Nevada-based company (&#8220;Redwood&#8221;) working to drive down the costs and environmental footprint
of lithium-ion batteries by offering large-scale sources of domestic anode and cathode materials produced from recycled batteries. Mr.&#160;Straubel
also co-founded and served as the Chief Technology Officer of Tesla from May&#160;2005 to July&#160;2019. Mr.&#160;Straubel previously
served on the board of SolarCity and as a member of its Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee from August&#160;2006 until its
acquisition by Tesla in November&#160;2016. Mr.&#160;Straubel has served on the board of directors of QuantumScape since November&#160;2020.
Mr.&#160;Straubel holds a B.S. in Energy Systems Engineering and a M.S. in Engineering, with an emphasis on energy conversion, from Stanford
University.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">As a co-founder and one of the key members of Tesla&#8217;s
leadership team for over a decade, Mr.&#160;Straubel brings extensive operational experience and in-house knowledge of Tesla&#8217;s technology,
research and development and business management. Mr.&#160;Straubel also provides valuable expertise in the areas of cleantech and batteries.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Kathleen
Wilson-Thompson</i></b></span> has been a member of the Board since December&#160;2018. Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson served as Executive
Vice President and Global Chief Human Resources Officer of Walgreens Boots Alliance,&#160;Inc., a global pharmacy and wellbeing
company, from December&#160;2014 until her retirement in January&#160;2021, and previously served as Senior Vice President and Chief
Human Resources Officer from January&#160;2010 to December&#160;2014. Prior to Walgreens, Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson held various
legal and operational roles at The Kellogg Company, a food manufacturing company, from January&#160;1991 to December&#160;2009,
including most recently as its Senior Vice President, Global Human Resources. Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson has served on the board of
directors of Wolverine World Wide,&#160;Inc. since May&#160;2021 and McKesson Corporation since January&#160;2022. She has also
served on the board of directors of Health Care Service Corporation since October 2024. Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson previously served on the board of
directors of Ashland Global Holdings Inc. from 2017-2020. Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson holds an A.B. in English Literature from the
University of Michigan and a J.D. and L.L.M. (Corporate and Finance Law) from Wayne State University.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Ms.&#160;Wilson-Thompson brings extensive executive
and board experience at both consumer-focused and industrial companies. In addition, her expertise in managing human resources, employment
law and other operations at mature companies with large workforces provides the Board with valuable insight and advice for workforce management
and relations as Tesla continues to expand.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><b><i>Additional Information</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">On October&#160;16, 2018, the U.S. District Court
for the Southern District of New York entered a final judgment approving the terms of a settlement filed with the court on September&#160;29,
2018, in connection with the actions taken by the SEC relating to Elon Musk&#8217;s August&#160;7, 2018 Twitter post that he was considering
taking Tesla private. On April&#160;26, 2019, this settlement was amended to clarify certain of its terms, which was subsequently approved
by the Court. Mr.&#160;Musk did not admit or deny any of the SEC&#8217;s allegations, and there is no restriction on Mr.&#160;Musk&#8217;s
ability to serve as an officer or director on the Board.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 6; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->3<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; margin-top: 0pt; margin-right: 0; margin-bottom: 0pt"><b><i>Audit Committee</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Board has four standing committees comprised
solely of independent directors&#8212;the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
and the Disclosure Controls Committee. The Audit Committee, which has been established in accordance with Section&#160;3(a)(58) of the
Exchange Act, currently consists of Robyn&#160;Denholm, Joe Gebbia and James Murdoch, each of whom is &#8220;independent&#8221; as such
term is defined for audit committee members by the listing standards of The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC (&#8220;Nasdaq&#8221;). Ms.&#160;Denholm
is the chair of the Audit Committee. The Board has determined that Ms.&#160;Denholm is an &#8220;audit committee financial expert&#8221;
as defined in the rules&#160;of the SEC.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><b>Executive Officers</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The names of Tesla&#8217;s executive officers,
their ages, their positions with Tesla and other biographical information as of April&#160;30, 2025, are set forth below. Except for
Messrs.&#160;Elon Musk and Kimbal Musk, who are brothers, there are no other family relationships among any of our directors or executive
officers.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-left: auto; width: 80%; border-collapse: collapse; margin-right: auto">

    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>

  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">

    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap; text-align: center"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">47</span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Chief Financial Officer</span></td>
    </tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF">
    <td style="padding-left: 0.1in; text-indent: -0.1in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Xiaotong (Tom) Zhu</span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap; text-align: center"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">45</span></td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">Senior Vice President, APAC</span></td>
    </tr>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Elon
Musk. </i></b></span><i>For a brief biography of Mr.&#160;Musk, see &#8220;Board of Directors&#8212;Background and Qualifications&#8221;
under this Item&#160;10 above.</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Vaibhav
Taneja</i></b></span>&#160;has served as our Chief Financial Officer since August&#160;2023. Prior to his appointment as CFO, Mr.&#160;Taneja
served as Tesla&#8217;s Chief Accounting Officer since March&#160;2019, as Corporate Controller from May&#160;2018, and as Assistant Corporate
Controller between February&#160;2017 and May&#160;2018. Mr.&#160;Taneja served in various finance and accounting roles at SolarCity from
March&#160;2016. Mr.&#160;Taneja holds a Bachelors of Commerce degree from Delhi University and is a Certified Public Accountant (inactive).</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b><i>Tom
Zhu</i></b></span> has served as our Senior Vice President since April&#160;2023, and Senior Vice President, APAC, since January 2025. Mr.&#160;Zhu joined Tesla in April&#160;2014,
and served in various operational roles before being appointed as Vice President, Greater China, where he led the construction and
operations of Gigafactory Shanghai. Mr.&#160;Zhu holds a bachelor&#8217;s degree of commerce in information technology from the
Auckland University of Technology and an M.B.A. from Duke University.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><b>Delinquent Section&#160;16(a)&#160;Reports</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Under Section&#160;16 of the Exchange Act, Tesla&#8217;s
directors, executive officers and any persons holding more than 10% of the Tesla&#8217;s common stock are required to report initial ownership
of the Tesla common stock and any subsequent changes in ownership to the SEC. Specific due dates have been established by the SEC, and
Tesla is required to disclose in this Amendment any failure to file required ownership reports by these dates. Based solely upon a review
of forms filed with the SEC and the written representations of such persons for their 2024 fiscal&#160;year transactions, Tesla is aware
of no late Section&#160;16(a)&#160;filings.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><b>Code of Business Ethics and Corporate Governance Guidelines</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">The
Board sets high standards for Tesla&#8217;s workforce, officers and directors. Tesla is committed to establishing an operating
framework that exercises appropriate oversight of responsibilities at all levels throughout the Company and managing its affairs in
a manner consistent with rigorous principles of business ethics. Accordingly, Tesla has adopted a Code of Business Ethics, which was
amended in April&#160;2024, and which is applicable to Tesla and its subsidiaries&#8217; directors, officers and personnel. The Code
of Business Ethics sets forth Tesla&#8217;s guiding principles, which include thinking before acting, treating everyone with
respect, protecting our information and assets and doing business with integrity. Tesla has also adopted Corporate Governance
Guidelines, which, in conjunction with our certificate of incorporation, bylaws and charters of the standing committees of the
Board, form the framework for Tesla&#8217;s corporate governance. The Code of Business Ethics and the Corporate Governance
Guidelines are each available on Tesla&#8217;s website at: http://ir.tesla.com/corporate. Tesla will disclose on its website any
amendment to the Code of Business Ethics, as well as any waivers of the Code of Business Ethics, that are required to be disclosed
by the rules&#160;of </span>the SEC or Nasdaq.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 7; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->4<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><b>Hedging, Short Sales and Rule&#160;10b5-1 Trading Plans</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Tesla has an insider trading policy that is
reasonably designed to promote compliance with insider trading laws, rules&#160;and regulations and Nasdaq listing standards. The
insider trading policy prohibits all of our directors, officers and employees from, among other things, engaging in short sales,
hedging or similar transactions designed to decrease the risks associated with holding Tesla securities. This prohibition
encompasses transactions in publicly-traded options, such as puts and calls, and other derivative securities with respect to Tesla
securities, but not transactions designed to facilitate portfolio diversification, such as broad-based index options, futures or
baskets. It is also the policy of Tesla to comply with all applicable securities laws when transacting in its own securities. A copy
of the insider trading policy is filed as Exhibit&#160;19 to the Original Form&#160;10-K.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><span id="a_004"></span><b>ITEM&#160;11.&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;&#8239;EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><b>Compensation Discussion and Analysis</b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><i>The following discussion and analysis of compensation
arrangements of our named executive officers for 2024 should be read together with the compensation tables and related disclosures set
forth below. This discussion contains forward-looking statements that are based on our current considerations, expectations and determinations
regarding future compensation programs. The actual amount and form of compensation and the compensation programs that we adopt may differ
materially from current or planned programs as summarized in this discussion.</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The following discussion and analysis relates to
the compensation arrangements for 2024 of (i)&#160;our principal executive officer, (ii)&#160;our principal financial officer, (iii)&#160;the
most highly compensated person, other than our principal executive officer and principal financial officer, who was serving as executive
officer at the end of our fiscal&#160;year ended December&#160;31, 2024 and (iv)&#160;our former Senior Vice President, Powertrain and
Energy Engineering, who served in such capacity during part of 2024 (our &#8220;named executive officers&#8221;). We had no other executive
officers serving at the end of our fiscal&#160;year ended December&#160;31, 2024. Our named executive officers for fiscal&#160;year 2024
were:</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-left: auto; width: 80%; border-collapse: collapse; margin-right: auto">

    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>
    <td style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; white-space: nowrap"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt"><b>Position</b></span></td>
    </tr>
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #CCEEFF">

    <td style="white-space: nowrap">&#160;</td>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Mr.&#160;Baglino departed Tesla in April&#160;2024.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><b><i>Overview and Fiscal&#160;Year 2024 Company Highlights</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Our current executive compensation program, which
was developed and approved by the Compensation Committee, generally consists of base salary and equity-based incentives, as well as other
benefits generally available to employees. We combine these elements in order to formulate compensation packages with the goal of providing,
on a total basis, competitive pay and aligning the interests of our named executive officers with long-term shareholder interests by tying
the value of their compensation to our long-term stock price and/or the achievement of financial, operational and strategic objectives.
In 2024, Tesla&#8217;s full-year accomplishments under our executive leadership included the following:</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>Model Y was the best-selling vehicle, of any kind, globally for the full year 2024;</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; color: #212529"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>Reached lowest average cost of goods per vehicle ever at less than $35,000;</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; color: #212529"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>31.4 gigawatt hours of energy storage, representing an increase of 113.3%, compared to the prior&#160;year, and the completion of
construction of Megafactory Shanghai; and</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 8; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->5<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; color: #212529"><tr style="vertical-align: top">
<td style="width: 0.5in"/><td style="width: 0.25in"><span style="font-family: Symbol; font-size: 10pt">&#183;</span></td><td>Further improvements and deployment of our FSD (Supervised) capabilities, including through increased AI training compute by over
400% in 2024 and the introduction of our purpose-built Robotaxi product, Cybercab.</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.5in"><b><i>Compensation Philosophy</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Our mission is to accelerate the world&#8217;s
transition to sustainable energy. This is a long-term mission, and our compensation programs reflect this&#160;&#8212; and our startup
origins&#160;&#8212; in that they consist primarily of salary or wages and equity awards. Whereas salary or wages are intended to meet
our employees&#8217; near-term liquidity needs, we believe that equity awards are an effective tool for retaining employees long-term,
as they vest incrementally over a period of time or upon the achievement of specified performance milestones intended to be achieved over
the medium- and long-term. During periods in which our stock price and the underlying value of equity awards increase, their retention
impact is even greater. We believe that the potential for such increases also creates an ownership culture that promotes holding equity,
which in turn aligns the interests of our employees with the long-term interests of our shareholders. Additionally, this compensation
philosophy further allows our employees to grow their skill sets and contributions consistent with our long-term mission. For these reasons,
our goal is to provide each employee with the opportunity to participate in our equity programs, with certain cash-based bonus programs
serving generally to accommodate specific incentive structures or liquidity needs. In light of these considerations, we generally do not
make annual grants of equity awards to our senior executives, including our named executive officers</span>, and instead grant equity
awards from time to time based upon individual roles and contributions and the retentive impact of currently outstanding equity awards.
By combining salary or wages and our equity award program, we strive to offer a total level of compensation that is competitive within
specific roles and geographical markets.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">In particular, we believe that compensation for
the individuals who are responsible for Tesla&#8217;s strategic direction and operations should motivate them to achieve sustainable shareholder
value and/or tangible milestones rather than to simply remain at Tesla or maintain the status quo. Therefore, while we offer to our general
employee population restricted stock units that will retain some value even if the market value of our stock decreases, when grants are
made to executive officers those grants generally comprise stock option awards, which have zero initial value and accumulate value,
if at all, only to the extent that our stock price increases following their grant, through the applicable vesting dates and until such
stock options are ultimately exercised and the underlying shares are sold. In addition, because equity awards comprise a greater proportion
of our executive officers&#8217; total level of compensation compared to comparable roles at peer companies, a sustained decrease in our
stock price or failure to achieve the applicable operational milestones may result in a level of total compensation that is significantly
less than that of such peer roles. Likewise, our outside director compensation program has been comprised primarily of equity awards that
are entirely in the form of stock option awards, as well as relatively modest cash retainer payments that may be waived at the election
of each director. Each director determined to forego all cash retainer payments in 2024.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">We evaluate our compensation philosophy and programs
regularly and evolve them as circumstances merit with oversight by the Compensation Committee, particularly with respect to executive
and director compensation. For example, if our stock price experiences significant movement over a short period of time that results in
a persistent change to equity compensation, certain adjustments may be considered to align our compensation programs to their intended
purposes.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in"><span style="font-family: Times New Roman, Times, Serif; font-size: 10pt">In
2024, we reviewed our compensation programs with respect to our senior executives to align our compensation programs to their intended
purposes, including striving to offer a total level of compensation that reflects individual performance to be competitive within specific
roles and geographical markets and to provide appropriate retentive impact in light of currently outstanding equity awards. Following
this review, in October&#160;2024, the Compensation Committee, in consultation with its compensation consultant and our Chief Executive
Officer, adjusted base salaries and/or granted equity awards to certain senior executives, which included Mr. Taneja, one of our named
executive officers, whose compensation had not been adjusted since he was promoted to the role of Chief Financial Officer in August 2023,
as described below.</span></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Additionally, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors has established a Special Committee to consider certain compensation matters involving
Mr. Musk.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><b><i>Key Factors in Determining Executive Compensation</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Role of Compensation Committee in Executive Compensation</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Compensation Committee has overall responsibility
for recommending to the Board the compensation of our Chief Executive Officer and reviewing and determining the compensation of our other
executive officers. Members of the Compensation Committee are appointed by the Board. Currently, the Compensation Committee consists of
three members of the Board: Ira Ehrenpreis (Chair), Robyn Denholm and Kathleen Wilson-Thompson, none of whom is an executive officer of
Tesla, and each of whom qualifies as&#160;an &#8220;independent director&#8221; under the Nasdaq Stock Market Rules&#160;and is deemed
independent under all applicable requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission and Tesla&#8217;s Corporate Governance Guidelines,
which follow the Nasdaq framework for the determination of independence.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 9; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->6<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Role of Compensation Consultants</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Compensation Committee has the authority to
engage, and has from time to time engaged, the services of outside consultants to assist in making decisions regarding the establishment
of Tesla&#8217;s compensation philosophy and programs, including for executives and directors. In 2024, Compensia,&#160;Inc., a national
consulting firm (&#8220;Compensia&#8221;) was retained as a compensation consultant to advise the Compensation Committee with respect
to Tesla&#8217;s executive compensation program.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Role of Executive Officers in Compensation Decisions</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Historically, for executive officers other than
our Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee has sought and considered input from our Chief Executive Officer regarding such
executive officers&#8217; responsibilities, performance and compensation. Specifically, our Chief Executive Officer recommends base salary
increases and equity award levels for our senior personnel, and advises the Compensation Committee regarding the compensation program&#8217;s
ability to attract, retain and motivate executive talent. These recommendations reflect compensation levels that our Chief Executive Officer
believes are qualitatively commensurate with an executive officer&#8217;s individual qualifications, experience, responsibility level,
functional role, knowledge, skills and individual performance, as well as Tesla&#8217;s performance. The Compensation Committee considers
our Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s recommendations, but ultimately determines compensation in its judgment and approves the compensation
for all of our executive officers (other than for our Chief Executive Officer, the compensation for whom is recommended by the Compensation
Committee to, and ultimately approved by, the Board).</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Compensation Committee meets regularly in executive
session. Our Chief Executive Officer is not present during Compensation Committee deliberations or votes on his compensation and also
recuses himself from sessions of the Board where the Board acts on the Compensation Committee&#8217;s recommendations regarding his compensation.
In addition, the Board has established a management committee under the Tesla,&#160;Inc. 2019 Equity Incentive Plan (the &#8220;Equity
Award Committee&#8221;) to grant and administer equity awards,&#8239;subject to certain
limitations, such as, among other things, maximum limits on the seniority of personnel to whom the Equity Award Committee may grant awards
and the value of any individual award. For example, the Equity Award Committee is not authorized to grant awards to employees at or above
the level of vice president. Moreover, pursuant to applicable law, the Equity Award Committee may not grant awards to its members, and
the number of shares of our common stock underlying awards granted by it may not exceed amounts determined by the Board from time to time.
The Board has delegated to the Compensation Committee oversight authority over the Equity Award Committee.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Role of Shareholder Say-on-Pay Votes</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">At our 2024 annual meeting, our shareholders overwhelmingly
approved the compensation of our named executive officers, with approximately 79% of our shareholders present and entitled to vote at
the meeting voting in favor of our compensation policies for our named executive officers. Given these results, the Compensation Committee
has decided to retain our overall approach to executive compensation while continuing to evaluate our practices.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">At the 2023 annual meeting of shareholders, our
shareholders indicated a preference for an annual shareholder advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers. Consistent
with the results of the shareholder vote, we intend to hold a shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation every year until the
next vote on the frequency of shareholder advisory votes on executive compensation. We are required to hold a &#8220;say on frequency&#8221;
vote at least every six years regarding how often to hold a shareholder advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Clawback Policy</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">We maintain a clawback policy for compliance with
the Nasdaq listing standards and Section&#160;10D of the Exchange Act. This clawback policy applies to current and former executive officers
in the event that the Company is required to prepare an accounting restatement due to the material noncompliance of the Company with any
financial reporting requirement under securities laws; misconduct on the part of the executive is not required. Under this clawback policy,
we are required to recoup incentive-based compensation (as that term is defined in Section&#160;10D of the Exchange Act) erroneously received
within the three completed fiscal years immediately preceding the date on which we are required to prepare an accounting restatement.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Page; Sequence: 10; Value: 1 -->
    <div style="border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 6pt"><p style="font-size: 10pt; text-align: center; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><!-- Field: Sequence; Type: Arabic; Name: PageNo -->7<!-- Field: /Sequence --></p></div>
    <div style="break-before: page; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 12pt"><p style="margin: 0pt">&#160;</p></div>
    <!-- Field: /Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">Our Corporate Governance Guidelines also sets forth
a compensation recovery (&#8220;clawback&#8221;) policy with respect to our executive officers. Moreover, the terms of the performance-based
stock option award granted to Elon Musk in January&#160;2018 (the &#8220;2018 CEO Performance Award&#8221;) include a clawback provision
in the event of a restatement of our financial statements previously filed with the SEC. See &#8220;<i>Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#8212;Chief
Executive Officer Compensation&#8212;2018 CEO Performance Award</i>&#8221; under this Item&#160;11 below.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><b><i>Current Elements of Named Executive Officer Compensation</i></b></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0 0pt 0.25in"><i>Base Salary</i></p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing
our Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s and other executive officers&#8217; base salaries. The base salaries of all executive officers are
reviewed and adjusted when necessary to reflect individual roles, performance and the competitive market. Because we currently do not
provide cash bonuses to our executive officers, salary is the primary cash-based element of our executive officers&#8217; compensation
structure.</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-indent: 0.5in">In connection with the 2024 review of our compensation programs discussed
in &#8220;<i>Compensation Philosophy</i>&#8221; above, the Compensation Committee increased Mr.&#160;Taneja&#8217;s base salary to reflect
his promotion in August 2023 to the role of Chief Financial Officer. Mr.&#160;Zhu&#8217;s base salary decreased in 2024 as compared to
2023 due to certain geographic considerations that arose in 2023 when he was on assignment from Gigafactory Shanghai. The following table
sets forth information regarding the annualized base salary rates at the end of 2024 for our named executive officers:</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-left: auto; border-collapse: collapse; width: 80%; margin-right: auto">
  <tr style="vertical-align: bottom">

  </table>










<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><div style="width: 25%"><div style="border-top: Black 1pt solid; font-size: 1pt">&#160;</div></div><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></p>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 100%; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><tr style="vertical-align: top">

                                                           adjusted in October&#160;2024.</td></tr></table>

<p style="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&#160;</p>
